sections.heading: About Me
sections.content: Roman Slack is a 19-year-old AI-focused Computer Science student at Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT), currently working as an AI Research Intern at the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). With a passion for building intelligent systems and open-source tools, Roman has cultivated expertise across full-stack development, reinforcement learning environments, and agent-based simulations.

sections.heading: Background
sections.content: Roman's work spans from founding a nonprofit programming camp to leading cutting-edge research with defense applications. He actively contributes to the open-source community and maintains a growing GitHub portfolio of experimental and production-ready AI tools, focusing heavily on agentic LLMs, AI pipelines in Unity environments, and scalable RL infrastructure.

sections.heading: Core Interests
items: Agentic Large Language Models & AI Pipelines
